reviews.review_msg: Paul is one of the few professors who really seems to care about teaching. He posts lecture notes online so you don't have to worry if you've missed the occasional class, but I still recommend going as he's a great explainer and will pause lectures to patiently answer any questions you have as thoroughly as possible before continuing.

Paul is the kind of prof that gets you interested in a course because of him. He's amazing, extremely knowledgable and approachable and truly cares about students. If a lot of people got an assignment question wrong or found it hard he'd spend more time on the concept next lecture for more practice. I felt very supported by him and learned a lot!

Challenging class..  -Find a study group to work with! If you don't communicate with others, you will get overwhelmed by the homework. -Adopt his point of view. You must learn to think like him and understand what he expects from you on the homework to do well.  Other than that he is a great lecturer but can be a bit stubborn at times.

I've been reading comments about him and don't understand how they came about. Upper division math students would love Dr. Brown; if you still get the chance to study with him, do it! He's very knowledgeable in math, and is a really nice, friendly, approachable professor.

Explains complex ideas well. Assignments are tough; exams are hard, though fair. Lectures were quite interesting, if overly abstract; perhaps, though, that's only to be expected in a special topics course.

Dr. Ashby is clearly passionate about his subject and teaching it to others. If you study the notes, do the homework, and ask for help you will do well in the course. His lectures are clear, the homework is fair, the exams are fair, Ben is reachable outside of class, etc. He sets students up for success.

I did find some of the lectures and notes difficult to follow but Ben was more than happy to clarify afterwards. Homework and exams were fair. Eager to seek student feedback to adjust material e.g. added a review lecture for diffy eqs since most students forgot. So supportive of students. If you're struggling, don't be afraid to ask for help!
